text: El Hedim Square (, "the square of demolition") is a famous square in Meknes, Morocco. The square was built in the years 1672-1674 after the Sultan of Morocco, Moulay Ismail, demolished half of the Old city of Meknes for his palace and the square. the Mansour Gate is in the front of the square. == Other websites == Category:Buildings and structures in Morocco Category:Town squares Category:17th-century buildings and structures
title: El Hedim Square
